title.narrative: DEVCO: Strengthening the Rule of Law in Afghanistan to Improve Access to Justice for Women and Girls

description.narrative:
The main specific objectives of this Action (outcomes) are (1) to tackle VAWG/SGBV through provision of legal specialized services, awareness of rights and empowerment opportunities (full circle of support) and (2) to strengthen existing justice structures to be better equipped to assist survivors of VAWG/SGBV and to improve accountability and performance of the EVAW Units at AGO.
The project will be implemented in consortium with TDH (lead), WCUK, AEPO and AIBA in Kabul, Nangarhar (Torkham and Jalalabad), Takhar, and Herat.
War Child Activities will include:
Year 1: -Provision of PSS comprehensive and tailor-made services to women and children survivors of violence in the ICs, the WPs and the WPCs in the targeted locations. -Creation of women’s and children’s safety nets through peer activities and family strengthening support programme. - Awareness Raising Programme provided to on women and children survivors of violence, their families and community members to enhance knowledge of the EVAW Law, information and promotion of the rights of women and girls and how they can claim and access justice with safeguards, avenues for support and accountability mechanisms. - Provision of literacy classes and life skill sessions to women and child survivors at the ICs, WPs and WPCs.
Year 2: -Provision of PSS comprehensive and tailor-made services to women and children survivors of violence in the ICs, the WPs and the WPCs in the targeted locations. -Creation of women’s and children’s safety nets through peer activities and family strengthening support programme. -Elaboration of a gender market assessment at the targeted locations to inform vocational training and skills development with real income-generating opportunities -Provision (technical and material support) of Vocational/Business Creation Training at the ICs, WPs and WPCs, including certification and networking sessions with potential employers.
Year 3: -Provision of PSS comprehensive and tailor-made services to women and children survivors of violence in the ICs, the WPs and the WPCs in the targeted locations. -Creation of women’s and children’s safety nets through peer activities and family strengthening support programme. -Provision (technical and material support) of Vocational/Business Creation Training at the ICs, WPs and WPCs, including certification and networking sessions with potential employers.
